text: Some fruity notes clean lager. Easy to drink, nothing really stands out but its a good beer.

Solid dunkel, especially since Im not a lager guy. Roasted, deep malt front fades into hints of caramel and cookie, yet a modest herbal hopping keeps the sweetness at bay. Not too carbonated, thick and smooth, yet refrains from growing cloy as it warms.

A really solid dunkel weizen probably one of the better ones we have. Would like to get more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft flight @ their tasting room. Clear ruby color with a small beige head. Really good. Dark roasted and smoky flavors; Almost charred.
Smell of coffee, toasty malt, drink from bottle, taste of malt, coffee, light body, slightly sour hidden at finish. Good average beer.

2015 BJCP Category: 8A Munich Dunkel
AROMA: Toasty malts; dark chocolate; iced coffee; sweet but not cloying. Clean fermentation. 10/12APPEARANCE: Deep brown/black with red highlights. Small, tan, foam eventually dissipates. 2/3FLAVOR: Surprisingly sweet for the style; dark, toasted malt (not burnt or deeply roasted). Slight nut character in the background. Finish with strong toffee/chocolate flavors. Mild spicy hop bitterness for balance. Delicious. 18/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body, but still quite crisp. Sweet but not cloying. Smooth and highly quaffable. 5/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Almost a perfect beer. Impressive considering so few American breweries make this style. Probably the best of the style Ive had. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 44/50DISCLAIMER: The author is not a certified BJCP judge; therefore, this score sheet is not necessarily indicative of proper BJCP judging techniques and protocol. The author is grading to 2015 BJCP Guidelines in order to prepare for examination.
12oz bottle nose is toasty and roasty. Sip adds herbal and grassy bitterness. Goes down very easily almost like flat cola. Reminds me more of a schwartz bier. More than decent balance.

Pours near black with a seriously foamy tan head. Wild lacing. Nose is cocoa and caramel with a hint of anise. Taste is predominately sweet and malty. Pleasant brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color is dark chocolate. Almost black. Aroma has roasted/smokey barley. Mouthfeel is light. Finishes smooth, malty, and pretty quickly. 

*12 oz bottle into pint glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft in Pigeon Forge. Pours a dark copper brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, cocoa powder, caramel, lightly toasted bread, light floral notes, definitely about the malts, pretty good for what it is.

Deep brown pour with a tan head.
Sweet malty aroma.
The flavor is lightly sweet on the front side with a touch of roast malt bitterness in the finish.
Pours a semi clear brown with a thin quickly dissipating head. Aroma hints at caramel. Very light bodied.

Brown pour with off white head and lace. Aroma is sweet caramel malt with a hinto chocolate. A touch of spicy hops aroma as well. Flavor is semi sweet malt with a finish that includes a touch of chocolate with light floral notes. Medium body with light carbonation. A step away somewhere from being really good. solid

Draft sample. The beer is a clear amber to brown with a beige head of foam. The aroma has nuances of toffee and some ash and chocolate. The taste has moderate sweetness and some bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Bottle. Clear deep brown with a medium sized light tan head. Aroma is light chocolate, mocha, roasted grains. Taste is chocolate, caramel, toffee, and toast.

Good carbonation. Malty with a chocolate toasty flavor. Good mouthfeel fading head. Toast aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from the tap at the brewery into a pint glass. This beer is a dark brown to black color with a small white head. It has a nice smoky flavor with a nice smooth texture. A really good Dunkel.
On tap at Alliance Brewing. Black, creamy beige head. Smells fruity and some roasted notes. Not as sweet as some dunkels, more roasted tasting. Some woody flavored, too. Pretty good...

Pint on tap. Near ebony body has some ruby tints. A lasting ring and small islands of cream on top. Nose is dark bread, espresso with touches of caramel and tart berry. Tastes of mocha, graham cracker and dark toast. Theres some berry, ash and marshmallow on the finish. Medium bodied with a medium-low carbonation and an excellent balance. Seems more of a Schwarzbier, but tasty no matter how you categorize it.
